Subject: intracellular filling
Value: visualization of the connected regions of a cell by filling with a label

Subject: glycerol permeabilized
Value: tissue made permeable by the action of glycerol

Subject: macroscopy
Value: methods for imaging objects large enough to be observed by the unaided eye

Subject: microscopy
Value: methods for forming images of objects too small to be observed with the unaided eye

Subject: dark-field microscopy
Value: imaging with rejection of the unscattered illumination (removal of the zero order component of the diffracted wave)

Subject: scanning electron microscopy (SEM)
Value: image is formed by scanning the surface of the specimen with a beam of electrons in a raster pattern

Subject: atomic force microscopy
Value: the scanning probe is maintained at a fixed distance above the surface e of the specimen by van der Waals forces

Subject: solvent permeabilized
Value: permeabilization due to extraction of lipid from membranes by an organic solvent such as acetone or methanol.

Subject: recorded image
Value: methods and devices used for capturing an image of a real object; distinct from images created by artwork

Subject: portrayed image
Value: methods and devices used for creating images by some form of artwork, as distinct from capturing images by means of some recording device

Subject: detection method
Value: media and devices employed for recording the alterations in the illumination that result from its interaction with the sample

Subject: widefield illumination
Value: illumination that covers the entire field of view of the image-forming lens

Subject: narrowfield illumination
Value: illumination restricted to a small portion of the field of view of the imaging lens; often one or more diffraction limited spots

Subject: pulsed illumination
Value: illumination that varies with time; often achieved with pulsed lasers for the purpose of generating very-high peak illumination power

Subject: single point scanning
Value: illumination by a single spot of light that is scanned across the field of view

Subject: multiple point scanning
Value: illumination by multiple points of light simultaneously

Subject: spinning disk scanning
Value: scanning by multiple points of light arising from pinholes in a spinning disk that is illuminated by a widefield source

Subject: hollow-cone illumination
Value: illumination parallel or at small angles to the optical axis is attenuated or blocked by a stop

Subject: darkfield illumination
Value: illumination restricted to angles that exceed the acceptance angle of the image-forming lens

Subject: Rheinberg illumination
Value: illumination at angles less than the acceptance angle of the image-forming lens is attenuated by a filter to give a colored background of unscattered light; higher angle illumination may be filtered to give a contrasting color

Subject: resolution-enhancing method
Value: methods for increasing the resolution beyond the classical Abbe diffraction limit

Subject: Wollaston prism
Value: a birefringent optical element typically used to split polarized illumination into two sets of parallel but displaced rays

Subject: saturated structured-illumination microscopy (SSIM)
Value: structured illumination used at sufficiently high power to cause significant ground-state depletion of the imaged fluorophore, thus allowing for non-linear resolution enhancement

Subject: scanning probe microscopy
Value: imaging by means of a physical probe that passes over the sample

Subject: linear method
Value: a computational method that is linear in the mathematical sense, meaning that image intensity is conserved and the data remain suitable for all quantitative analyses

Subject: non-linear method
Value: computational method that are mathematically non-linear; image intensity is not conserved, and the data are in general not suitable for quantitative analyses of pixel values

Subject: light-sheet illumination
Value: illumination in the form of a thin sheet of light directed perpendicular to the optic axis

Subject: OCT
Value: optical coherence tomography; an interferometric method of imaging using back-scattered photons (elastic scattering)

Subject: secondary_electron imaging
Value: image created using the electrons generated by ionization of a sample due to inelastic scattering of the primary beam of radiation

Subject: back-scattered_electron imaging
Value: imaged formed using electrons undergoing elastic scattering at very high angles, with emission of characteristic X-rays

Subject: slit-scanning illumination
Value: illumination in the shape of a thin line that is swept over the field of view

Subject: slit-scan confocal microscopy
Value: illumination and detection via a thin slit

Subject: visualization of contiguous regions
Value: methods of visualization that differentiate between different regions or surfaces of the specimen based on contiguity

Subject: visualization by chemical attribute
Value: methods of visualization that differentiate regions of the specimen on the basis of their chemical properties

Subject: shadowing and plating
Value: visualization by depositing a label on the surface of a specimen uniformly (plating), or from a particular direction so that surface topography becomes visible (shadowing)

Subject: negative staining
Value: visualization by exclusion of a stain in which the specimen is immersed; compare with \"positive staining.

Subject: Tetramethyl rhodamine (TRITC)
Value: fluorophore derivative of rhodamine with ex/em 547/572

Subject: secondary electron generation
Value: electrons generated by inelastic scattering of other radiation, the primary radiation.

Subject: critical_point dried specimen
Value: specimen from which water has been removed by a process that avoids liquid-gas and solid-gas phase transitions.

Subject: unprocessed raw data
Value: data as acquired, with no alterations that change the pixel values.

Subject: lyophilized specimen
Value: specimen from which water has been removed by evaporation under vacuum at a temperature below freezing.

Subject: X-Rhodamine
Value: fluorophore derivative of rhodamine with ex/em 580/605
